apoc.couchbase

Class Couchbase

  • java.lang.Object
    • apoc.couchbase.Couchbase

  • public class Couchbase
extends java.lang.Object
    Neo4j Procedures for Couchbase integration.

    All of the operations performed against the Couchbase Server are done through a CouchbaseConnection.
    A CouchbaseConnection can be created via the CouchbaseManager .getConnection method.

    Available operations are:

    • get(java.util.List<java.lang.String>, java.lang.String, java.lang.String) to retrieve a json document by its unique ID
    • exists(java.util.List<java.lang.String>, java.lang.String, java.lang.String) to check whether a json document with the given ID does exist
    • insert(java.util.List<java.lang.String>, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String) to insert a json document if it does not exist already
    • upsert(java.util.List<java.lang.String>, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String) to insert or overwrite a json document
    • remove(java.util.List<java.lang.String>, java.lang.String, java.lang.String) to remove the json document identified by its unique ID
    • replace(java.util.List<java.lang.String>, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String) to replace the content of the json document identified by its unique ID
    • append(java.util.List<java.lang.String>, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String) to append a json document's content to an existing one
    • prepend(java.util.List<java.lang.String>, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String) to prepend a json document's content to an existing one

    N1QL query can be executed via the following methods:

    • query(java.util.List<java.lang.String>, java.lang.String, java.lang.String) for plain un-parameterized N1QL statements
    • posParamsQuery(java.util.List<java.lang.String>, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.util.List<java.lang.Object>) for N1QL statements with positional parameters
    • namedParamsQuery(java.util.List<java.lang.String>, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.util.List<java.lang.String>, java.util.List<java.lang.Object>) for N1QL statements with named parameters
    For instance, after inserting a JSON document this way:

    call apoc.couchbase.insert(['localhost'], 'default', 'artist:vincent_van_gogh', '{"firstName":"Vincent","secondName":"Willem","lastName":"Van Gogh","notableWorks":["Starry Night","Sunflowers","Bedroom in Arles","Portrait of Dr Gachet","Sorrow"]}')

    you can read the just inserted document via:

    call apoc.couchbase.query(['localhost'], 'default', 'select * from default') yield queryResult
    unwind queryResult as queryResultRow
    call apoc.convert.toMap(queryResultRow) yield value as queryResultRowMap
    with queryResultRowMap.default as content
    return content.firstName, content.secondName, content.lastName, content.notableWorks

    Using JSON fields instead of the "*" notation makes things a bit easier:

    call apoc.couchbase.query(['localhost'], 'default', 'select firstName, secondName, lastName, notableWorks from default') yield queryResult
    unwind queryResult as queryRow
    return queryRow.firstName, queryRow.secondName, queryRow.lastName, queryRow.notableWorks

    Since:
    15.8.2016

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public java.util.stream.Stream<CouchbaseJsonDocument> get(java.util.List<java.lang.String> nodes,
                                                          java.lang.String bucket,
                                                          java.lang.String documentId)
        Retrieves a JsonDocument by its unique ID.

        Example: call apoc.couchbase.get(['localhost'], 'default', 'artist:vincent_van_gogh') yield id, expiry, cas, mutationToken, content

        Parameters:
        nodes - the list of nodes to use when connecting to the cluster reference
        bucket - the bucket to open; if null is passed then it's used the "default" bucket
        documentId - the unique ID of the document
        Returns:
        the found CouchbaseJsonDocument or null if not found
        See Also:
        Bucket.get(String)

      • exists

        public java.util.stream.Stream<BooleanResult> exists(java.util.List<java.lang.String> nodes,
                                                     java.lang.String bucket,
                                                     java.lang.String documentId)
        Check whether a JsonDocument with the given ID does exist.

        Example: CALL apoc.couchbase.exists(['localhost'], 'default', 'artist:vincent_van_gogh') yield value

        Parameters:
        nodes - the list of nodes to use when connecting to the cluster reference
        bucket - the bucket to open; if null is passed then it's used the "default" bucket
        documentId - the unique ID of the document
        Returns:
        true if it exists, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        Bucket.exists(String)

      • insert

        public java.util.stream.Stream<CouchbaseJsonDocument> insert(java.util.List<java.lang.String> nodes,
                                                             java.lang.String bucket,
                                                             java.lang.String documentId,
                                                             java.lang.String json)
        Insert a JsonDocument if it does not exist already.

        Example: CALL apoc.couchbase.insert(['localhost'], 'default', 'artist:vincent_van_gogh', '{"firstName":"Vincent","secondName":"Willem","lastName":"Van Gogh","notableWorks":["Starry Night","Sunflowers","Bedroom in Arles","Portrait of Dr Gachet","Sorrow"]}') yield id, expiry, cas, mutationToken, content

        Parameters:
        nodes - the list of nodes to use when connecting to the cluster reference
        bucket - the bucket to open; if null is passed then it's used the "default" bucket
        documentId - the unique ID of the document
        json - the JSON String representing the document to store
        Returns:
        the newly created JsonDocument or null in case of exception
        See Also:
        Bucket.insert(Document)

      • upsert

        public java.util.stream.Stream<CouchbaseJsonDocument> upsert(java.util.List<java.lang.String> nodes,
                                                             java.lang.String bucket,
                                                             java.lang.String documentId,
                                                             java.lang.String json)
        Insert or overwrite a JsonDocument.

        Example: CALL apoc.couchbase.upsert(['localhost'], 'default', 'artist:vincent_van_gogh', '{"firstName":"Vincent","secondName":"Willem","lastName":"Van Gogh","notableWorks":["Starry Night","Sunflowers","Bedroom in Arles","Portrait of Dr Gachet","Sorrow"]}') yield id, expiry, cas, mutationToken, content

        Parameters:
        nodes - the list of nodes to use when connecting to the cluster reference
        bucket - the bucket to open; if null is passed then it's used the "default" bucket
        documentId - the unique ID of the document
        json - the JSON String representing the document to store
        Returns:
        the newly created or overwritten JsonDocument or null in case of exception
        See Also:
        Bucket.upsert(Document)

      • append

        public java.util.stream.Stream<CouchbaseJsonDocument> append(java.util.List<java.lang.String> nodes,
                                                             java.lang.String bucket,
                                                             java.lang.String documentId,
                                                             java.lang.String json)
        Append a JsonDocument's content to an existing one.

        Example: CALL apoc.couchbase.append(['localhost'], 'default', 'artist:vincent_van_gogh', '{"placeOfBirth":"Zundert","placeOfDeath":" Auvers-sur-Oise"}') yield id, expiry, cas, mutationToken, content

        Parameters:
        nodes - the list of nodes to use when connecting to the cluster reference
        bucket - the bucket to open; if null is passed then it's used the "default" bucket
        documentId - the unique ID of the document
        json - the JSON String representing the document to append
        Returns:
        the updated JsonDocument or null in case of exception
        See Also:
        Bucket.append(Document)

        public java.util.stream.Stream<CouchbaseJsonDocument> prepend(java.util.List<java.lang.String> nodes,
                                                              java.lang.String bucket,
                                                              java.lang.String documentId,
                                                              java.lang.String json)

        Parameters:

        bucket - the bucket to open; if null is passed then it's used the "default" bucket
        documentId - the unique ID of the document
        json - the JSON String representing the document to prepend
        Returns:
        the updated JsonDocument or null in case of exception
        See Also:
        Bucket.prepend(Document)

                                                             java.lang.String bucket,

        Example: CALL apoc.couchbase.remove(['localhost'], 'default', 'artist:vincent_van_gogh') yield id, expiry, cas, mutationToken, content

        Parameters:
        nodes - the list of nodes to use when connecting to the cluster reference
        bucket - the bucket to open; if null is passed then it's used the "default" bucket
        documentId - the unique ID of the document
        Returns:
        the removed JsonDocument
        See Also:
        Bucket.remove(String)

      • replace

        public java.util.stream.Stream<CouchbaseJsonDocument> replace(java.util.List<java.lang.String> nodes,
                                                              java.lang.String bucket,
                                                              java.lang.String documentId,
                                                              java.lang.String json)
        Replace the content of the JsonDocument identified by its unique ID.

        Example: CALL apoc.couchbase.replace(['localhost'], 'default', 'artist:vincent_van_gogh', '{"firstName":"Vincent","secondName":"Willem","lastName":"Van Gogh","notableWorks":["Starry Night","Sunflowers","Bedroom in Arles","Portrait of Dr Gachet","Sorrow"],"placeOfBirth":"Zundert","placeOfDeath":" Auvers-sur-Oise"}') yield id, expiry, cas, mutationToken, content

        Parameters:
        nodes - the list of nodes to use when connecting to the cluster reference
        bucket - the bucket to open; if null is passed then it's used the "default" bucket
        documentId - the unique ID of the document
        json - the JSON String representing the document to prepend
        Returns:
        the replaced JsonDocument
        See Also:
        Bucket.replace(Document)

      • query

        public java.util.stream.Stream<CouchbaseQueryResult> query(java.util.List<java.lang.String> nodes,
                                                           java.lang.String bucket,
                                                           java.lang.String statement)
        Executes a plain un-parameterized N1QL statement.

        Example: CALL apoc.couchbase.query(['localhost'], 'default', 'select * from default where lastName = "Van Gogh"']) yield queryResult

        Parameters:
        nodes - the list of nodes to use when connecting to the cluster reference
        bucket - the bucket to open; if null is passed then it's used the "default" bucket
        statement - the raw statement string to execute
        Returns:
        the list of JsonObjects retrieved by this query in the form of a CouchbaseQueryResult
        See Also:
        N1qlQuery.simple(Statement)

      • posParamsQuery

        public java.util.stream.Stream<CouchbaseQueryResult> posParamsQuery(java.util.List<java.lang.String> nodes,
                                                                    java.lang.String bucket,
                                                                    java.lang.String statement,
                                                                    java.util.List<java.lang.Object> params)
        Executes a N1QL statement with positional parameters.

        Example: CALL apoc.couchbase.posParamsQuery(['localhost'], 'default', 'select * from default where lastName = $1', ['Van Gogh']) yield queryResult

        Parameters:
        nodes - the list of nodes to use when connecting to the cluster reference
        bucket - the bucket to open; if null is passed then it's used the "default" bucket
        statement - the raw statement string to execute (containing positional placeholders: $1, $2, ...)
        params - the values for the positional placeholders in statement
        Returns:
        the list of JsonObjects retrieved by this query in the form of a CouchbaseQueryResult
        See Also:
        N1qlQuery.parameterized(Statement, JsonArray)

      • namedParamsQuery

        public java.util.stream.Stream<CouchbaseQueryResult> namedParamsQuery(java.util.List<java.lang.String> nodes,
                                                                      java.lang.String bucket,
                                                                      java.lang.String statement,
                                                                      java.util.List<java.lang.String> paramNames,
                                                                      java.util.List<java.lang.Object> paramValues)
        Executes a N1QL statement with named parameters.

        Example: CALL apoc.couchbase.namedParamsQuery(['localhost'], 'default', 'select * from default where lastName = $lastName', ['lastName'], ['Van Gogh']) yield queryResult

        Parameters:
        nodes - the list of nodes to use when connecting to the cluster reference
        bucket - the bucket to open; if null is passed then it's used the "default" bucket
        statement - the raw statement string to execute (containing named placeholders: $param1, $param2, ...)
        paramNames - the placeholders' names in statement
        paramValues - the values for the named placeholders in statement
        Returns:
        the list of JsonObjects retrieved by this query in the form of a CouchbaseQueryResult
        See Also:
        N1qlQuery.parameterized(Statement, JsonObject)
